Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
bonding \bonding\ n. the process of fastening firmly together.
Syn: soldering. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Bond \Bond\ (b[o^]nd), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Bonded}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Bonding}.] 1. To place under the conditions of a bond; to mortgage; to secure the payment of the duties on (goods or merchandise) by giving a bond. [1913 Webster]
2. (Arch.) To dispose in building, as the materials of a wall, so as to secure solidity. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: BONDING Bandwidth ON Demand INteroperability Group (org., manufacturer, AIM)

bonding n 1: fastening firmly together [syn: {soldering}] 2: a close personal relationship that forms between people (as between husband and wife or parent and child) 3: (dentistry) a technique for repairing a tooth; resinous material is applied to the surface of the tooth where it adheres to the tooth's enamel
